intro: Cassipourea letestui, commonly known as the Malagasy hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often pubescent, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
